name: Gingivitis
description: Gum Disease. Occurs when plaque and bacteria build up on your teeth and cause infection.

name: Mouth Ulcers
description: One or more painful sores on inner lips, gums, tongue, roof of the mouth or throat that may interfere with eating, such as a canker sore.

name: Tooth Discolouration
description: The staining or darkening of teeth.

name: Abrasions
description: An area damaged by scraping or wearing away.

name: Bruises
description: An injury appearing as an area of discoloured skin on the body, caused by a blow or impact rupturing underlying blood vessels.

name: Burns
description: An injury caused by exposure to heat or flame (first and second degrees only).

name: Cuts/Lacerations
description: A deep cut or tear in skin or flesh.

name: Diabetic Wounds
description: A serious complication caused by a combination of poor circulation, susceptibility to infection and nerve damage from high blood sugar levels.

name: Surgical Wounds
description: A cut through the skin made during surgery.

name: Venous Wounds
description: A wound on the leg or ankle caused by abnormal or damaged veins.

name: Cellulitis
description: Skin condition that causes lumpy, dimpled flesh on the thighs, hips, buttocks and abdomen.

name: Impetigo
description: A contagious bacterial skin infection forming pustules and yellow crusty sores.

name: Athleteâ€™s Foot
description: A fungal infection that usually begins between the toes.

name: Ringworm
description: A highly contagious fungal infection of the skin or scalp.

name: Cutaneous Larva Migran
description: An infectious syndrome caused by multiple types of hookworms.

name: Chicken Pox
description: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.

name: Shingles
description: Painful, usually itchy, rash that develops on one side of the face or body.
